===Etymology===
Origin unclear. Attributed to noted Edo-period botanist and scholar of Chinese medicine Ono Ranzan (see [[Wikipedia:ja:小野蘭山]]) in the late 1700s. May be from {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=はれいしょ'}} {{m|zh|馬鈴薯}}, or may be a Japanese coinage later borrowed into Chinese.

According to one theory, this word is a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=はれいしょ'|馬鈴|tr1=barei|t1=horse bell|薯|tr2=sho|t2=potato}}, from the way the potato looks a bit like the [[bell]]s used in the [[tack]] for [[stage]] [[horse]]s.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> In another theory, {{m|ja|馬鈴|tr=barei}} is an example of [[ateji]] for {{m|en|Malay}}, since potatoes were introduced to Japan via the [[Dutch East Indies]].
